args.natural_language_statement: Every map of sets f : S → G to a group extends uniquely to a morphism of groups f : ⟨S⟩ → G from the free group on the set S, mapping each s ∈ S to f(s), extending linearly to all words on the alphabet S.

retrieved_examples.nl: For any types α β and function f : α → β, there exists a unique function g : α → β such that g = f.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem unique_extension_example {α : Type*} {β : Type*} (f : α → β) : ∃! (g : α → β), g = f := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: Any function f : S → G extends to a group homomorphism from the free group on S.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem free_group_lift {S : Type*} {G : Type*} [Group G] (f : S → G) : ∃ (φ : FreeGroup S →* G), ∀ s : S, φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s := by sorry

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Function Set

/-- Every map of sets \( f : S \to G \) to a group extends uniquely to a morphism of groups \( f : \langle S \rangle \to G \) from the free group on the set \( S \), mapping each \( s \in S \) to \( f(s) \), extending linearly to all words on the alphabet \( S \). -/
theorem free_group_lift {S : Type*} {G : Type*} [Group G] (f : S → G) :
    ∃! (φ : FreeGroup S →* G), ∀ s : S, φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s := so

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
Every map of sets f : S → G to a group extends uniquely to a morphism of groups
φ : ⟨S⟩ → G from the free group on the set S, mapping each s ∈ S to f(s).
-/

theorem free_group_lift {S : Type _} {G : Type _} [Group G] (f : S → G) :
  ∃! (φ : FreeGroup S →* G), ∀ s : S, φ (FreeGroup.of s) = f s := by sorry
